Package core

Class Mat3

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Matrix
      • core.Mat3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMatrix, IUtils, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Mat3>, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
    public class Mat3
extends Matrix
implements java.lang.Comparable<Mat3>
    A 3 x 3 matrix which stores nine elements in a 2D float array, row-major order. 
     | 0, 0 | 0, 1 | 0, 2 |
 | 1, 0 | 1, 1 | 1, 2 |
 | 2, 0 | 2, 1 | 2, 2 |
    This matrix can be used to create 2D affine transformations, bearing in mind that the first column stores the right-axis, the second stores the forward-axis and the third stores the translation. 
     | right x | forward x | translation x |
 | right y | forward y | translation y |
 | right w | forward w | translation w |
    The last row conventionally remains constant as 0, 0, 1.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static Mat3 createRotation​(float radians,
                                  Mat3 target)
        Creates a matrix from a rotation about the z axis. 
         |   cos ( a ) | - sin ( a ) | 0.0 |
 |   sin ( a ) |   cos ( a ) | 0.0 |
 |         0.0 |         0.0 | 1.0 |
        Parameters:
        radians - the angle in radians
        target - the output matrix
        Returns:
        the rotation matrix

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Mat3 m)
        Returns -1 when this matrix is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'. The implementation of this method allows collections of matrices to be sorted. This depends upon the static comparator of the Mat3 class, which can be changed.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Mat3>
        Parameters:
        m - the comparisand
        Returns:
        the numeric code
        See Also:
        COMPARATOR, getComparatorString(), setComparator(Comparator)

        m22 - the w component of the translation
        Returns:
        this matrix
